backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the SafarX.in backend, implementing user profiles, travel inquiries (submit/get/delete/list), community users, admin authentication (legacy token-based and principal-based), and blob storage via mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting that admin-gated actor calls in the frontend now use a localStorage session token instead of Internet Identity, with updated error messages redirecting to /admin/login.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-formatted summaries of all frontend source files, describing the purpose and key details of each component, page, hook, and config file in the SafarX.in frontend.
frontend/.env.example: Example environment file documenting the VITE_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID variable needed for Google OAuth 2.0 / Google Identity Services integration.
frontend/index.css: Root CSS file applying Tailwind base/components/utilities and defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens including sidebar, chart, and UI element colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the SafarX.in app, loading Google Fonts (Playfair Display, Inter, Cormorant Garamond), the Google Identity Services script, and the Vite React entry module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app component that sets up TanStack Router with two layout groups: a public layout (header + footer) for all user-facing routes, and a bare admin layout for /admin and /admin/login.
frontend/src/components/CommunityAuthMod: Modal dialog component handling community user login and registration via username/password forms and Google Identity Services (GSI) OAuth, with JWT payload decoding for Google sign-in.
frontend/src/components/CommunityFeed.ts: Renders a paginated feed of community travel posts with like, delete, and expand functionality. Includes a PostCard component that handles image errors, relative timestamps, and password-confirmed deletion.
frontend/src/components/CommunityProfile: Displays a logged-in user's profile page showing their posts and account details, with support for deleting posts (handling both Google and password-based auth).
A modal dialog form for creating a new community travel post with title, body, image URL, and destination fields, supporting both Google and password-authenticated users.
A card component that displays a destination's image, name, region, tags, and a link to its detail page, with special badges for Gen-Z and Hill Station tags.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Site-wide footer with brand info, social media links, region navigation, and quick links, rendered on a dark terracotta background.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Responsive fixed navigation header for SafarX with scroll-aware background, active link highlighting, and a mobile slide-out sheet menu covering Home, Destinations, Plan My Trip, Packages, Community, and Contact.
Variant of the main Header component that adds an Admin link (pointing to /admin) with a LayoutDashboard icon to the navigation, otherwise identical in structure and behavior.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Reusable full-screen hero section component that accepts a background image, headline, subheadline, and primary/secondary CTA links, with a parallax overlay and animated scroll-down indicator.
frontend/src/components/ItineraryTimelin: Displays a generated travel itinerary as a timeline with a summary header (destination, duration, travel style) and per-activity cards color-coded by Morning/Afternoon/Evening time slots.
frontend/src/components/PackageCard.tsx: Card component for a travel package showing its image with overlaid category/duration/price badges, a description, top three highlights, and a link to the package detail page.
frontend/src/data/destinations.ts: Static data file defining the Destination TypeScript interface and an array of Indian travel destinations (e.g., Agra, Varanasi, Shimla) with region, state, descriptions, best-time, highlights, and image paths.
frontend/src/data/packages.ts: Defines the `TravelPackage` interface and exports an array of travel package objects (e.g., Himalayan Adventure, Rajasthan Heritage Trail) with details like destinations, price range, highlights, and category.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor using React Query, returning either an anonymous or identity-authenticated actor and invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` context and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and identity persistence via `AuthClient`.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports React Query hooks and helpers for admin session management, inquiry CRUD operations, community stats/user listing, and admin registration/login against the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that sets up Tailwind CSS, defines a warm earthy OKLCH color palette (saffron, terracotta, teal, ivory) for light and dark modes, and adds custom utility classes for typography, hero overlays, and card hover effects.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider` wrappers around the root `App` component.
frontend/src/pages/Admin.tsx: Admin dashboard page that displays travel inquiries, community stats, and user lists fetched via React Query hooks, with support for deleting inquiries, session expiry handling, and logout navigation.
frontend/src/pages/AdminLogin.tsx: Admin authentication page supporting both login and registration modes, using Internet Identity for registration and username/password credentials for login, with session token-based redirect to the admin dashboard.
frontend/src/pages/Community.tsx: Community page with a hero banner and tabbed layout showing a community feed and user profile, with an auth modal for unauthenticated users.
frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx: Contact/inquiry form page that supports prefilled destination from URL search params and submits travel inquiries via a mutation hook, showing a success state on completion.
frontend/src/pages/DestinationDetail.tsx: Detail page for a single destination looked up by ID from static data, displaying a hero image, badges, description, and highlights with a fallback for unknown destinations.
frontend/src/pages/Destinations.tsx: Destinations listing page with region tab filters and a text search input that filters the static destinations list, displaying results as destination cards.
frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx: The Home page component renders the landing page with a hero section, stats bar, featured destinations grid, and a 'Why Choose Us' section using data from destinations and static arrays.
frontend/src/pages/Packages.tsx: The Packages page displays a filterable grid of travel packages, allowing users to filter by category (Adventure, Cultural, Beach, etc.) using a sticky filter bar.
frontend/src/pages/PlanTrip.tsx: The PlanTrip page provides an AI-powered itinerary planner form where users select a destination, duration, travel style, and group type to generate a custom itinerary displayed via a timeline component.
frontend/src/types/google-gsi.d.ts: TypeScript declaration file that defines interfaces for the Google Identity Services (GSI) client library, including credential responses, button configuration, and the global `window.google` object.
frontend/src/utils/itineraryGenerator.ts: Utility module that generates day-by-day travel itineraries based on destination, duration, travel style, and group type, using predefined activity pools and group-specific tips.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility module providing helper functions to read, store, persist, and clear URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage fallback support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration for the SafarX frontend, extending the theme with custom fonts (Playfair Display, Cormorant Garamond, Inter), oklch-based color tokens (saffron, terracotta, and UI semantic colors), and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file (version 27) for the SafarX.in travel agency website, documenting existing features, known issues (admin dashboard bugs, Google Sign-In z-index problem, admin principal mismatch), architectural notes, and contact details.
